title: 114_s2327
content: The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" is the short title of this Act. It includes a permanent extension of modifications to the Earned Income Tax Credit. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, such as increasing the credit percentage for families with 3 or more children and raising the maximum amount for joint returns. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" increases the maximum amount for joint returns by substituting $5,000 for $3,000. Inflation adjustments are also made for calendar year 2008. The effective date for these amendments is taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014. The "Foster EITC Act of 2015" increases the maximum amount for joint returns to $5,000 from $3,000, with inflation adjustments for 2008. Effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. The Act also amends the table in section 32(b)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, increasing the credit for individuals with no qualifying children to $8,820 and $10,425. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the tax rate from 7.65% to 15.3%. The eligibility age for certain childless individuals and youth formerly in foster care is lowered to age 21 (or age 18 for youth formerly in foster care). The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new section regarding youth formerly in foster care, defining them as individuals who were in foster care at or after the age of 16. "SEC. 6050X. RETURNS RELATING TO YOUTH IN FOSTER CARE." Any State, local, or tribal agency responsible for reporting data to the Adoption and Foster Care Analysis and Reporting System must submit a return for individuals in foster care over the age of 16. Once a return is made for an individual, subsequent returns for that individual in future years may not be required. The return must be made in the form and manner specified by the Secretary. The automated child welfare information system requires individuals to furnish a written statement with specific information by January 31 each year. The automated child welfare information system mandates individuals to provide specific information on a written statement by January 31 of the following year. Penalties may apply for non-compliance with the requirements outlined in section 6050X related to youth in foster care.
